positions.description:
Company Description
-------------------

Whatever it takes to make our residents feel at home – that’s what we do! We are passionate about providing quality apartments homes, in a respectful environment, across twenty key markets in the USA. We are a publicly traded Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT), who has, for more than 25 years, built its business around a relentless focus on our customer and our award-winning culture.

Job Description
---------------

We are hiring an intern for Summer 2024 to help our Resident Support Team team with various admin tasks and processes. You will work at our Corporate Office located in the heart of the Denver Tech Center.
A bit more about what you’ll do…
---Providing administrative support for Accounts / Customer Care team
---Closing final accounting statements
---Mailing and managing security deposit refunds
---Some data-entry tasks

Qualifications
--------------

---High school diploma
---Prior admin experience is a plus
---Strong attention to detail and organization skills
---Desire to learn
---Good computer skills (Microsoft Office)
---Ability to read, write, and speak English

Additional Information
----------------------

Expected pay rate of $18.30 /hour.

Company Description
-------------------

AIR Communities, a Real Estate Investment Trust based in Denver, CO, is one of the nation's largest owners and operators of multifamily apartment housing. We manage high-quality properties in major markets like Boston, Denver, Philadelphia, Los Angeles, and Miami. We seek motivated professionals who excel in customer service, and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. If you're inclined towards more challenging tasks and aspire to exceed expectations, our environment may align better with your ambitions, join us! Our values include integrity, respect, collaboration, customer focus, and performance, upheld by our dedicated team. Join us for unlimited career opportunities and work alongside industry-leading professionals.

Job Description
---------------

Job Description
We are hiring a challenge-seeking Accountant who enjoys solving problems and takes pride in discovering the right solutions. A team player who enjoys working alongside their colleagues in fast paced environment where the time flies because every day is a busy one. Sound like you? Join our Accounting team in the Denver Tech Center, where you’ll be responsible for:
---Ensuring accuracy of corporate financial records and reports for assigned duties.
---Prepare and enter journal entries for month-end close process and management of our debt.
---Complete monthly, quarterly and yearly balance sheet reconciliations. 
---Provide related variance analysis monthly, quarterly and annually.
---Manage Prepaid, Accrued Expenses and Fixed/Intangible Asset schedules including recording depreciation and amortization.
---Collaborating among departments to share accounting data and improve efficiencies.
---Preparing, reviewing, and distributing financial reports.
---Preparing roll-forwards and financial analysis.
Keys to Success:
---Detail Oriented: You are consistently accurate, have an eye for detail and would always spot an error.
---Motivated: You are driven and strive to always put forth your best work. You are someone who wants to make an impact!
---Team Focused: You are passionate about collaboration and being part of a driven team! You take pride in your team’s contribution to the overall company success!
---Energized: You are determined and want to grow in your role. You seek opportunities to go the extra mile, and find time to focus on personal growth.

Qualifications
--------------

---Experience conducting variance analysis.
---Experience conducting actual to budget/forecast analysis.
---Experience with monthly, quarterly balance sheet reconciliations.
---Experience recording monthly journal entries, accruals, reclasses, etc. 
---Experience with debt reconciliation.
---Bachelor’s degree in Accounting preferred. 
---1-2+ two years of relevant experience.
---Proficient financial system skills with an emphasis on Excel, SmartView
---Workday Financials experience a plus.
---Superb attention to detail.
---Nimble problem solver who enjoys complex challenges.
---Demonstrates quality customer service, teamwork, and cultural fit.

Additional Information
----------------------

AIR offers attractive total compensation packages designed to recognize and reward performance at the individual, team and company levels. We start with a competitive base salary and add bonus opportunities and benefit choices topped off with:
---Expected pay rate of $65,000 - $78,000. You will be provided a pay rate that is in line with your skills and experience as they relate to the requirements of the job.
---Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance options available. HSA with company sponsored contributions, FSA (traditional and dependent care FSA).
---Short and long-term disability paid by the company.
---401(K) and Employee Stock Purchase Plans.
---Paid Vacation, 9 Paid Holidays, and Paid Sick Time.
---Tuition Assistance Program.
---Commuter Benefits and Pet-Insurance.
---Up to 100% Reimbursement on Professional Certification/Licensing for Job Related Curriculums.
---Discounted Rent at AIR communities (certain exclusions apply, and an application is required).
---Paid parental leave of up to 16 weeks, following the birth or adoption of a child.
---Consumer discounts from various products and services including travel planning, wireless phones, health and fitness, home appliances, and more.
---15 hours of paid time annually to give-back to your community.
---Opportunities for professional development and career growth including realistic job previews, in person and virtual leadership training, and performance improvement courses.

Company Description
-------------------

We are AIR Communities, one of the country's largest owners and operators of apartment communities, managing high-quality properties in most major markets! Our team is passionate about providing exceptional service to our residents and communities. If you're a hardworking, detail-oriented, and customer-focused professional, we want you to join us!

Job Description
---------------

Our Traveling Service Operations Support Manager will provide coverage and support to our communities with vacant Service and Maintenance Manager positions. They will also provide managerial support to our communities with essential and time-sensitive hardships. This position will serve as the subject matter expert on direct maintenance and service operations, vendor management and mentoring.
This is a heavy travel position with up to 75% of the year or 3 weeks per month on the road or in the air.
A bit more about what you’ll do…
---May serve as the acting Service Manager wherever/ whenever assigned and provide the standard operational support required of AIR’s Service Managers.
---May provide regional oversight of all aspects of Property Maintenance Management of multiple communities as assigned including service requests, management, turn process, preventative maintenance, training and supervision of staff.
---Provide support to the Regional Offices in supporting the operations for properties assigned.
---Assist Property Managers, Service Managers, Regional Property Managers, Area Service Managers, Directors of Service & Quality and Directors of Operations in the completion of action plans required as the result of an audit.

Qualifications
--------------

---Ability to travel at least 75% of the time with easy access to large Airport
---Strong preference be located within one of AIR's main markets: DC Metro, Miami Metro, Boston area, or Philadelphia area. 
---At least 5 years of experience in Multifamily Service Operations Management
---At least 2 years of experience in direct Service Management role
---Proven track record in managing large properties, be a motivator, a good communicator, and a hands-on manager
---Must possess strong team building, coaching and training skills, multiple site supervision experience and excellent customer service background, a strong financial results orientation and a demonstrated ability to enhance value at the community level

Additional Information
----------------------

AIR offers attractive total compensation packages designed to recognize and reward performance at the individual, team and company levels. We start with a competitive base salary and add bonus opportunities and benefit choices topped off with:
---Expected pay rate of $$90,000 - $105,000. You will be provided a pay rate that is in line with your skills and experience as they relate to the requirements of the job.
---Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance options available. HSA with company sponsored contributions, FSA (traditional and dependent care FSA).
---Short and long-term disability paid by the company.
---401(K) and Employee Stock Purchase Plans.
---Paid Vacation, 9 Paid Holidays, and Paid Sick Time.
---Tuition Assistance Program.
---Commuter Benefits and Pet-Insurance.
---Up to 100% Reimbursement on Professional Certification/Licensing for Job Related Curriculums.
---25% Discounted Rent at AIR communities (certain exclusions apply, and an application is required).
---Paid parental leave of up to 16 weeks, following the birth or adoption of a child.
---Consumer discounts from various products and services including travel planning, wireless phones, health and fitness, home appliances, and more.
---15 hours of paid time annually to give-back to your community.
---Opportunities for professional development and career growth including realistic job previews, in person and virtual leadership training, and performance improvement courses.
Candidates extended an offer will be required to undergo a four-panel drug screening that excludes marijuana testing

Company Description
-------------------

Apartment Income REIT Corp., known as AIR Communities, is a publicly traded Real Estate Investment Trust headquartered in Denver, CO. We are one of the country's largest owners and operators of multifamily housing, managing high-quality properties in most major markets, including Boston, Denver, Philadelphia, Los Angeles, and Miami! At AIR, we value integrity, respect, collaboration, customer focus, and performance. These values are brought to life by our teammates, who are ultimately responsible for our success. When you join our team, you'll work alongside the most dedicated professionals in the industry and open the door to unlimited career opportunities.

Job Description
---------------

Job Summary:
As the Executive Administrative Assistant at AIR Communities, you will be the right-hand person to our Assistant to the CEO and play a pivotal role in providing comprehensive support to the CEO. This role will require a highly skilled, adaptable, and flexible individual who can seamlessly handle a wide range of administrative, organizational, and personal assistant tasks. The successful candidate will be expected to work in-office daily.
Key Responsibilities:
---Handle confidential information with the utmost discretion and maintain the highest level of professionalism.
---Collaborate closely with the Assistant to the CEO to efficiently support the CEO's schedule and priorities.
---Provide extensive administrative support, including but not limited to scheduling meetings, coordinating travel arrangements, and managing email and phone communications.
---Prepare, edit, and proofread documents, reports, and presentations for the CEO.
---Assist in organizing and facilitating internal and external meetings, including scheduling and logistics.
---Manage and maintain records, both digital and physical.
---Coordinate and manage special projects and events as needed.
---Act as the CEO's gatekeeper, screening and prioritizing requests and inquiries as needed.
---Provide personal assistant support, such as scheduling personal appointments and completing requested daily tasks.
---Handle any ad-hoc tasks or projects as assigned by the CEO or Assistant to the CEO.
---Provide first line support as needed in the absence of the Assistant to the CEO.

Qualifications
--------------

---3-5+ years of experience as an Executive Assistant or similar role.
---Exceptional organizational and time-management skills.
---Demonstrated ability to utilize independent judgement and decision-making skills to effectively prioritize and balance multiple high priority tasks requested simultaneously.
---Ability to independently self-manage and motivate to proactively anticipate needs.
---Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact with individuals at all levels.
---Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.
---High degree of discretion, professionalism, and integrity.
---Regular schedule Monday-Friday 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, however flexibility to work outside of standard business hours when necessary.
---Adaptability to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Education:
---Bachelor's degree preferred, but not required.

Additional Information
----------------------

AIR offers attractive total compensation packages designed to recognize and reward performance at the individual, team and company levels. We start with a competitive base salary and add bonus opportunities and benefit choices topped off with:
---Expected pay rate of $75,000-$90,000 plus annual bonus. You will be provided a pay rate that is in line with your skills and experience as they relate to the requirements of the job.
---Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance options available. HSA with company sponsored contributions, FSA (traditional and dependent care FSA).
---Short and long-term disability paid by the company.
---401(K) and Employee Stock Purchase Plans.
---Paid Vacation, 9 Paid Holidays, Wellness Bonus Days, and Paid Sick Time.
---Tuition Assistance Program.
---Commuter Benefits and Pet-Insurance.
---Up to 100% Reimbursement on Professional Certification/Licensing for Job Related Curriculums.
---Discounted Rent at AIR communities (certain exclusions apply, and an application is required).
---Paid parental leave of up to 16 weeks, following the birth or adoption of a child.
---Consumer discounts from various products and services including travel planning, wireless phones, health and fitness, home appliances, and more.
---15 hours of paid time annually to give-back to your community.
---Opportunities for professional development and career growth including realistic job previews, in person and virtual leadership training, and performance improvement courses.
Candidates extended an offer will be required to undergo a four panel drug screening that excludes marijuana testing.
AIR values diversity and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. Job Description
---------------

You will work at Foxchase Apartment Homes, our expansive 2,000+ unit apartment community located on 88 wooded acres and just 5 minutes away from Historic Downtown! 
Check it out here: www.foxchaseofalexandriaapts.com 
A bit more about what you’ll do…
---Provide admin support to leasing staff
---Managing resident paperwork for new leases and renewals 
---Handling the entire Move-In process.
---Assisting with making appointments and follow-up calls for leasing staff.
---Respond to and manage resident complaints and/or service issues at the Shared Service Center and may coordinate with appropriate staff to address and resolve resident concerns.
---Monitors resident retention.
---Assist residents with any need

---Assist with parcel pending (package deliveries)
---Enter in service requests for residents

When you join our team, you'll work alongside the most dedicated professionals in the industry and open the door to unlimited career opportunities..

Job Description
---------------

Our Resident Resolutions Coordinator is a very active and fast-paced/ high - volume job. You will be working to understand and develop programs for temporary resident relocation to mitigate and limit property disruptions resulting from onsite projects, in conjunction with company Community Managers and Area Operations Leaders. 
You will work at our Residences at Capital Trail located in Bethesda, MD along with Willard Tower Apartment Homes located in Chevy Chase, MD. 
A bit more about what you’ll do…
---Analyze lease expiration and rates to influence project schedule and execution.
---Participate in the project planning stage of major construction projects to prepare and execute all aspects of the resident relocation plan within associated relocation budgets.
---Coordinate daily/weekly/monthly schedules with the company's Vice President – Operations/ Senior Director of Asset Quality along with representatives of company property operations and company Construction Services and the General Contractor to ensure that relocation and Redevelopment goals and schedules are being met.
---Develop and execute resident relocation and communication plans and presentations, including delivering written notice to vacate to residents, lead and maintain communication with residents and identify and address the relocation aspects of residents with special needs as it relates to project execution.
---Assist Construction Services with the tracking of units and report status when units go through the different redevelopment phases (up & down units), tracking forecast move out/in to actual.
---Work with residents to assess and select vendors and hotels to arrange temporary living arrangements and assess resident ongoing satisfaction, seeking feedback and adjusting process for any substandard feedback. Collaborate with internal team(s) to ensure full compliance with company policy and applicable law.

Qualifications
--------------

---2 years customer service experience in a fast-paced service environment (ie, property management, hospitality, retail, restaurant etc.).
---Ability to provide exceptional customer service to address the needs of current and future residents in a friendly and professional manner.
---A reliable mode of transportation.
---Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and weekends.

---Project management and property operations experience preferred.

positions.positionName: Temporary Resident Resolutions Coordinator - Affordable Housing
positions.description:
Company Description
-------------------

You used to know us as "Aimco Apartment Homes" but now we're called "AIR Communities!" Though the company has changed, our approach to property management has not. We will continue to do whatever it takes to make our residents feel at home - it's just in our nature! We are still passionate about providing quality apartments homes, in a respectful environment, across twenty key markets in the USA. We are a publicly traded Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT), who has, for more than 25 years, built its business around a relentless focus on our customer and our award-winning culture.

Job Description
---------------

We’re looking for a Temporary Resident Resolutions Coordinator (3-4 months) who will focus on Occupancy Specialist training to work at our Foxchase Apartment Homes located in Alexandria, VA. Take look at them here: [foxchaseofalexandriaapts.com] (https://www.foxchaseofalexandriaapts.com/) 
This position is located in an affordable community that is covered by government regulations.
A bit more about what you’ll do…
---Making appointments, receiving and screening visitors and telephone calls using a telephone script.
---Maintaining and controlling confidential files and records.
---Preparing leases for occupancy and making initial computation of rents and monthly payments according to authority policy.
---Reviewing applications and interviews applicants for housing.
---Maintains the waiting list of applicants for housing and determines applicant eligibility.
---Maintaining continuing compliance and resident relations, upholding all fair housing principles, and applying the unique Program rules correctly including the student, unit transfer, unit vacancy and available unit rules.

Qualifications
--------------

---2-4 years of related experience.
---Generally has specific experience in the regulatory occupancy field.

Additional Information
----------------------

AIR offers attractive total compensation packages designed to recognize and reward performance at the individual, team and company levels. We start with a competitive base salary and add bonus opportunities and benefit choices topped off with:
---Expected pay rate of $22 – $28 per hour. You will be provided a pay rate that is in line with your skills and experience as they relate to the requirements of the job.
---Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance options available. HSA with company sponsored contributions, FSA (traditional and dependent care FSA).
---Short and long-term disability paid by the company.
---401(K) and Employee Stock Purchase Plans.
---Paid Vacation, 9 Paid Holidays, Wellness Bonus Days, and Paid Sick Time.
---Tuition Assistance Program.
---Commuter Benefits and Pet-Insurance.
---Up to 100% Reimbursement on Professional Certification/Licensing for Job Related Curriculums.
---Discounted Rent at AIR communities (certain exclusions apply, and an application is required).
---Paid parental leave of up to 16 weeks, following the birth or adoption of a child.
---Consumer discounts from various products and services including travel planning, wireless phones, health and fitness, home appliances, and more.
---10 hours of paid time annually to give-back to your community.
---Opportunities for professional development and career growth including realistic job previews, in person and virtual leadership training, and performance improvement courses.
AIR values diversity and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. AIR prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Company Description
-------------------

We are AIR Communities, a top apartment community operator managing properties in major markets. Our team is passionate about providing exceptional service to our residents and communities. If you're a hardworking, customer-focused, and sales-driven professional, we want you on our team!

Job Description
---------------

Our Leasing Teammates are top sales performers, providing exceptional customer experiences and driving sales through the execution of AIR's sales process.
AIR Communities offers a unique opportunity for our Leasing Consultants to enjoy a Winter Break after peak season has ended. You will keep all your benefits (including your 25% rent discount) during this unpaid break while you refresh & recharge during the holiday season! During your time off from late October/November through January, the opportunities are endless; take vacations, follow passions, spend time with loved ones, volunteer, take a seasonal holiday job! Then, come February, be ready to return and do it all again!
You will work at Laurel Crossing Apartment Homes, our 418-unit apartment community located in San Mateo, CA! Check it out here: [https://www.laurelcrossingapthomes.com/] (https://www.laurelcrossingapthomes.com/) 
Responsibilities: 
---Manage consumer life cycle, from acquisition to retention.
---Lease apartments and assist in community marketing.
---Follow sales process for on-site visits, including scheduling, presenting, giving tours, and following up.
---Provide leasing support to all communities in AIR portfolio.
---Consistently reach or exceed monthly leasing goals.

Qualifications

---1+ year sales and customer service experience in a fast-paced environment (e.g., property management, hospitality, retail, or restaurant).
---Familiar with goal setting/achievement and following a sales process.
---Exceptional customer service skills to address current/future resident needs.
---Reliable transportation.
---Flexible schedule availability, including evenings/weekends.
---Proficient in reading, writing, and speaking English.
The most successful AIR Leasing Teammates are:
---Sales Innovators
---Customer-Focused
---Passionate
---Organized
---Concise Communicators
---Motivated
---Solution-Focused
#PIQ

Additional Information
----------------------

AIR offers attractive total compensation packages designed to recognize and reward performance at the individual, team, and company levels. We start with a competitive base salary and add bonus opportunities and benefit choices topped off with:
---Expected base pay rate of $18 - $20 per hour + lucrative commissions. (Annual income anticipated between $68,000 - $80,000+) You will be provided a pay rate that is in line with your skills and experience as they relate to the requirements of the job.
---25% Rent Discount available!
---Opportunity for extended time-off with benefits during slower parts of the year.
---Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance options, HSA/FSA plans, short and long-term disability paid by the company.

We are AIR Communities, one of the country's largest owners and operators of apartment communities, managing high-quality properties in most major markets! At AIR, we're passionate about what we do, both inside and outside of work. Our culture goes beyond our high-performing team; it also influences and enhances relationships with our residents and the communities we serve. We believe in doing whatever it takes to make our residents feel at home.
If you are a hardworking, customer-focused professional, who takes pride in your work and has an eye for detail, we want you on our team!

Job Description
---------------

Our Service Team is the heart of AIR Communities! Service Technicians make our communities a great place to live by providing outstanding service to our residents. To say thank you, we provide our service technicians with the opportunity to make one of our beautiful communities their home!
Our Service Team is crucial to AIR Communities, and we show our appreciation by offering Service Techs a 50% rent discount to live onsite. Say goodbye to commuting, save time, gas money, and mileage while spending more time with family. Enjoy calling the community you maintain, "home."
You will work at Elm Creek, Modern Apartments and Townhomes in Elmhurst near Great Shopping, Dining, and Entertainment. Check it out here: [https://www.elmcreekapthomes.com/] (https://www.elmcreekapthomes.com/) 
We recognize that every teammate and property is unique, so we will consider your skills and experience with an open mind when hiring for this role. Your job title will be based on your skills, experience, and the community's requirements.
Responsibilities:
---Provide exceptional service to residents and team members.
---Perform resident-requested repairs and services independently (e.g., HVAC troubleshooting, complex plumbing installations/repairs, electrical component troubleshooting/replacement, household appliance installations/repairs/replacements).
---Provide technical guidance and training to lower-level Service Technicians and support their technical skill development.
---May assist in vendor quality management.

Qualifications
--------------

---1-3 years of maintenance experience, preferably in a facilities or building environment
---Proficient in all trades OR expert in at least two trades (plumbing, electrical, appliances, HVAC, carpentry, etc.)
---Positive attitude with a willingness to learn
---Desire to grow professionally.
As an AIR Service Technician, you'll need:
---Reliable transportation
---Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, 7-day weeks (as needed), and on-call shifts (at least one week per month) based on community needs and seasonality
---Physical capability to move heavy equipment and machinery
---Proficiency in reading, writing, and speaking English.
Top AIR Service Technicians are:
---Tech-savvy
---Mechanically skilled
---Customer-focused
---Highly organized
---Expert troubleshooters
---Team players
---Detail-oriented experts.

Additional Information
----------------------

AIR offers attractive compensation packages that reward performance at the individual, team, and company levels. We start with a competitive base salary, bonuses, and benefit options topped off with:
---Expected pay rate of $19.00- $23.50 per hour. You will be provided a pay rate that is in line with your skills and experience as they relate to the requirements of the job.
---Technicians who excel can earn up to $1,500 in quarterly Customer Service Satisfaction bonuses.
---50% rent discount available at any AIR Community.
---Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance options, HSA/FSA plans, short and long-term disability paid by the company.
---401(K), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, tuition assistance program, commuter benefits, and pet insurance.
---Paid time off including vacation, holidays, and sick time.
---Up to 100% reimbursement for job-related certifications and licenses.
---Paid parental leave of up to 16 weeks.
---Consumer discounts on various products and services.
---15 hours of paid time annually for community service.
---Opportunities for professional development and career growth.
Candidates extended an offer will be required to undergo a four-panel drug screening that excludes marijuana testing.

Company Description
-------------------

Whatever it takes to make our residents feel at home – that’s what we do! We are passionate about providing quality apartments homes, in a respectful environment, across twenty key markets in the USA. We are a publicly traded Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT), who has, for more than 25 years, built its business around a relentless focus on our customer and our award-winning culture.

Job Description
---------------

Performs general or specialized maintenance and repairs in multifamily residential setting. Applies proficient skills in all maintenance trades (Generalist), or expert level skills in at least two maintenance trades (Specialist) and operates building systems and related equipment and tools to complete tasks to resident's satisfaction.
You will work at our Park Towne Premier Apartment Homes located in the Museum District neighborhood, of Philadelphia, PA.
A bit more about what you’ll do…
---With minimal guidance, troubleshoots and performs most (Generalist) maintenance and repairs on a variety of building systems and appliances, or all repairs on specific systems (Specialist), including HVAC, plumbing, structural, and electrical.
---With minimal direction, and in a professional manner, complete resident-requested repairs and service and preventive maintenance tasks. 
---Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, to residents and team members regarding planned and completed tasks.
---Understand and follow local and corporate company Standard Operating Procedures.
---Understand and follow safe work practices for all trades, including but not limited to: Lockout Tagout, Electrical Safety, and Confined Space Entry, use of hazardous chemicals, and use of Personal Protective Equipment, Ladder Safety, and working from Elevated Surfaces.
---Typical independent assignments include (as appropriate to Generalist or Specialty): Troubleshoot, repair, or replace HVAC equipment and controls; install, repair, and replace all plumbing fixtures, piping, and systems; troubleshoot, replace, and install new electrical fixtures, switches, breakers, and receptacles; Prepare and finish all interior and exterior surfaces; move, install, repair, replace all household appliances; Install, repair, and replace drywall, counters, and cabinetry; all landscaping tasks; Operate and repair all pool equipment.
---Other duties as assigned.
---Responsible for seeking education opportunities and self-improvement for personal growth and development.

Qualifications
--------------

---Must have maintenance experience and/or be trade school graduate. 
---Intermediate level understanding and experience in five or more maintenance trades, (Generalist) or Advanced level understanding and experience in two or more basic trades (Specialist): HVAC, Plumbing, Electrical, Painting, Appliance Repair, Carpentry, Landscaping, or Pool Operation.
---Demonstrate the appropriate and safe use of standard hand and power tools (Generalist), or the specialized tools of two or more trades (Specialist) listed in item (2) above.
---Must be willing to learn to assist mechanics where needed. 
---Must have a general working knowledge of how to repair, maintain and trouble-shoot electrical, plumbing, mechanical and HVAC systems. 

Additional Information
----------------------

Standard union rate at $19.80.
The benefits included with this position are based off the Collective Bargaining Agreement standards.

Company Description
-------------------

AIR Communities (Apartment Income REIT Corp.), is a publicly traded Real Estate Investment Trust headquartered in Denver, CO. We are one of the country's largest owners and operators of multifamily housing, managing high-quality properties in most major markets, including Boston, Denver, Philadelphia, Los Angeles, and Miami! At AIR, we value integrity, respect, collaboration, customer focus, and performance. These values are brought to life by our teammates, who are ultimately responsible for our success. When you join our team, you'll work alongside the most dedicated professionals in the industry and open the door to unlimited career opportunities.

Job Description
---------------

We’re looking for a reliable Part Time Doorman who will perform doorman duties including front desk security, answers phones and intercom, handles packages and deliveries and greets residents and their guests.
Schedule available:
Sunday: 4:00 PM - 12:00 Midnight
Monday 4:00 PM - 12:00 Midnight
You will work at our Hyde Park Tower located in Chicago, IL. Check them out for yourself here: [Hyde Park Tower] (https://www.hydeparktowerapartments.com/) !

Qualifications
--------------

---0-2 years customer service experience in a fast paced service environment (ie, property management, hospitality, retail, restaurant etc.).
---High school education

Additional Information
----------------------

Expected pay for this position is $20.35/hour.
The benefits included with this position are based off the Collective Bargaining Agreement standards.

About Us:
=========

Our mission is to make real estate investments, primarily focused on the multifamily sector within targeted US markets, where outcomes are enhanced through our human capital and substantial value is created for investors, teammates, and the communities in which we operate.

Position Details:
=================

Job Code: AD507
Job Title: Finance Associate
Aimco is a diversified real estate investment company with a nearly 30-year history of growth and innovation in the multifamily sector. Today, the Aimco platform is focused on a total return strategy that includes development, redevelopment, and other opportunistic investments that offer the prospect of outsized returns on a risk-adjusted basis, while also maintaining an allocation to stabilized properties.
We’re looking for an FP&A Finance Associate who will work closely with the existing team and leadership to build and support monthly forecasting, executive reporting, annual budgeting, and other strategic financial and data analysis.
Essential Functions:
---Support monthly and quarterly variance analysis of business and property performance versus annual budget, forecast, and prior year.
---Prepare financial analyses including monthly forecast updates and annual budgets.
---Build and distribute reports utilized by senior leadership and business partners to drive sound decisions.
---Assist in the preparation of financial reporting to support quarterly and annual SEC filings.
---Work extensively in MS Excel, Workday Office Connect, and Adaptive Planning.
Education and Experience: A bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, business, or similar. 2-5 years’ experience in FP&A or Accounting preferred.
Qualifications: Advanced Excel skills, excellent written and verbal communication, organizational, analytical, and people skills. Combines detail-oriented focus and a big-picture perspective.
Aimco offers an incredible well-being package including gold-standard medical benefits, dental and vision benefits, and more. In addition to a flexible working environment, Aimco offers annual wellness accounts, free breakfasts, healthy snacks, and more. Annual vacation starts at 3 weeks, with an additional 15 paid holidays, plus 8 days of sick pay per year.
www.aimco.com
Supervisory Responsibilities: Non-Supervisory
Education and Experience: Bachelor’s degree in accounting or business or equivalent. At least 2-5 years’ experience.
Qualifications: Excellent written and verbal communication, organizational, analytical, and people skills. Combines detail- oriented focus and a big-picture perspective.
Work Environment: Office environment. Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Travel may be required. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by the team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is frequently required to sit, talk, or listen. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Reasonable accommodation will be made to enable team members with disabilities to perform the essential functions, and team members who believe they need such accommodation should contact Human Resources.

Salary Range:
=============

Hiring Salary range: $75,000-$90,000 annually plus a generous annual bonus. Candidates will be hired at a salary commensurate with their skills and experience relative to the role.

positions.description:
The Team
We are seeking a Senior Reporting Analyst to join American Tower’s Finance Data Analytics (FDA) team. The FDA team partners with internal stakeholders to provide actionable insights and recommendations through analytics and storytelling. Day to day you will deliver and interpret reporting that promotes overall business effectiveness and efficiency. As a Senior Reporting Analyst you will interface with business teams to understand key objectives and partner with report developers to deliver analytical products. You will prepare and use dashboards and reports, complete ad hoc requests, and serve as a liaison between the business team, report developers, and other reporting analysts throughout different functional areas.

What You Can Offer Us
---Work with internal customers to identify requirements and develop reporting and analytics to meet business needs. 
---Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements as well as documenting solution needs to ensure data accuracy of deliverables. 
---Analyze performance metrics and KPIs to identify trends, opportunities for improvement, and areas of risk. 
---Prepare and present reports and dashboards to leadership, summarizing key findings, trends, and performance metrics. 
---Proactively identify opportunities for process optimization, automation, and efficiency gains within the Finance department. 
---Conduct root cause, statistical trend and gap analyses to identify efficiency opportunities in internal processes using technical and analytical expertise. 
---Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to reporting and analytics. 
---Other duties as assigned. 
What You Need to Succeed
---Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Business, Math, Statistics or related business field. 
---A minimum of 5 years of experience in analytics, financial analysis, or similar field. 
---Advanced proficiency in data analytics and reporting tools such as Microsoft Excel, Oracle Analytics, Power BI, or Tableau required. 
---Self-starter with outstanding analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. 
---Must be meticulous, detail-oriented, and dependable. 
---Strategic mindset to align data capabilities with business objectives 
---Strong leadership and collaboration skills across multiple stakeholders. 
---Strong business acumen and demonstrated ability to translate data insights into actionable business recommendations, using visualization and storytelling. 
---Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex data insights to stakeholders. 
---Ability to handle multiple projects and easily adapts to new and changing situations. 
---Experience in the real estate or telecom infrastructure industry is a plus. 
---RDBMS, SQL, Python, R or machine learning experience is a plus. 
American Tower is a global digital infrastructure company serving customers through tower sites and other real estate solutions that support connectivity and opportunity, focused on achieving our vision of Building a More Connected World. Our success is rooted in the potential of our people and the power of local teams at our offices and sites across 25 countries.
We are one of the largest global Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) and a publicly traded (NYSE:AMT), Fortune 500 Company headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts. The next decade will be an exciting time as we evolve our infrastructure to meet tomorrow’s needs and position our people to elevate their impact, their potential, and our shared success. Come grow your career with us!
For more information about how American Tower is building a more connected world, visit americantower.com.
American Tower is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee based on age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, color, creed, religion, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, marital status, familial status, disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, reproductive decisions, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law.

The Team
We are seeking a Construction Manager (“CM”) to join American Tower’s Site Development organization. The Site Development team delivers all new assets and customer services programs and manages capital improvement and structural redevelopment projects across the Company’s portfolio. Day to day you will administer, coordinate, and oversee field-based construction activities on assigned projects within a defined geographic region. As a CM, you will partner cross-functionally to ensure assets are constructed and preserved through sound and consistent procedures. The CM assures safety, quality, and a high level of service to internal and external constituents and ensures consistent communication to all key internal and external stakeholders.
What You Can Offer Us
---Work with all levels of employees on construction projects; manage budgets, schedules, vendors, site designs, material ordering, progress monitoring, site utility coordination, and closeouts. 
---Develop estimates to be used as budgets for new site development and capital improvement projects. 
---Execute field team operational procedures to ensure consistent and continuous compliance by all employees and vendors with applicable safety and regulatory requirements, standards, and protocols. 
---Ensure all product lines are constructed within the standards set forth by American Tower Master Construction Specifications. 
---Meet project timelines and deliver quality products. 
---Proactively identify potential risk issues and collaborate with your manager to develop a preventative action plan to address them. 
---Troubleshoot, negotiate, and mediate client or subcontractor problems or complaints that arise at site level. 
---Other duties as assigned. 
What You Need To Succeed
---Four-year college degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Business, or Planning or equivalent work experience in the wireless site development industry required. 
---Minimum of 5 years of work experience in wireless site construction and/or other construction-related disciplines such as civil or building construction required. 
---Strong working knowledge of all aspects of the wireless tower industry, including citing and construction, engineering, zoning, tenant and ground leases, utility easements, and regulatory compliance preferred. 
---Demonstrated knowledge in managing wireless site construction through prior experience with either network deployment projects or construction management responsibilities. 
---Sound financial analysis and budgeting skills. 
---While performing the role you will need to lift up to 25 lbs. 
---Approximately 80% travel may be required in support of the position’s responsibilities. 
---Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively. 
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to effectively and professionally achieve results. 
---Strong organization skills; ability to accomplish multiple tasks within the agreed upon timeframes through effective prioritization of duties and functions in a fast-paced environment.

The Team
We are seeking an Information Security Program Manager to join American Tower’s Information Security organization. The Information Security team maintains and enhances the information security program. Day to day, you will plan, direct, and coordinate security-related initiatives, including audits and risk assessments, assist with deploying various controls, and develop processes to ensure standards across the security configurations. You will work closely with business and technology leaders to prioritize, and sequence proposed projects, identify trade-offs, and obtain resource allocations to optimize the execution of the portfolio of information security projects within the program roadmap.
What You Can Offer Us
---Review proposals or plans to determine projects’ time frames, funding limitations, procedures for completing, staffing requirements, and allotment of available resources to various phases. 
---Run projects/programs from design and development to production by using program and project management theories, methods, and techniques applicable to managing and delivering programs or projects. 
---Perform control and vulnerability assessments to identify weaknesses, assess the effectiveness of existing controls, and recommend enhancements. 
---Protect systems by defining access privileges, control structures, and resources. 
---Serve as a point of contact for IT and innovation teams to address control questions and assess control impacts on projects. 
---Facilitate and coordinate ongoing reviews and audits with identified business owners and ensure appropriate actions are taken based on the information gathered during those reviews. 
---Other duties as assigned. 
What You Need to Succeed
---Bachelor's degree in Information Systems or Computer Science or equivalent work experience required 
---A minimum of 5 years of IT, network security, or IT audit experience is required. 
---Experience with general computer controls and security topics required. 
---Experience developing, documenting, and maintaining access and security policies, processes, procedures, and standards preferred. 
---Strong project/program management skills, which include experience organizing, planning, and executing from vision through implementation of large-scale programs and projects involving internal personnel, contractors, and vendors are required. 
---Knowledge of access, security, and control risk assessment methods and technologies and/or audit experience required. 
---Knowledge of information security standards (e.g., ISO 27001/27002, NIST, etc.) and data privacy and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, etc.) required. 
---While performing the role you will need to lift up to 25 lbs. 
---Approximately 10% of travel may be required to support the position’s responsibilities. 
---Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively. 
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to effectively and professionally achieve results. 
---Strong organizational skills: ability to accomplish multiple tasks within the agreed-upon timeframes through effective prioritization of duties and functions in a fast-paced environment.

The Team
We are seeking an Account Manager, Recontracting to join American Tower’s Sales team. The Recontracting team works with existing customers to protect and strengthen revenue through strategic renewal negotiations. Day to day you will develop lease proposals through comprehensive analysis of contractual obligations to drive increased tower portfolio value. As an Account Manager, you will partner cross-functionally to manage tenant relationships throughout the entire leasing process and ensure a unified approach to each negotiation.
What You Can Offer Us
---Develop lease proposals while closing quarterly targeted quotas for assigned segment. Prepare and present written and verbal proposals/presentations to tenants, as needed. 
---Negotiate lease renewal terms with existing customers to improve profitability, mitigate churn risk, and ensure new agreements are in place prior to lease expiration. 
---Manage multiple transactions in excess of $1,000,000 in initial-term revenue with our customers. 
---Negotiate to drive solutions through project-specific financial negotiations; overcome customer objections and/or obstacles. 
---Identify re-contracting opportunities through internal pipelines and other relevant reporting provided by management. 
---Provide creative, optimal, and unified solutions when facilitating lease amendment activity for existing customers, while addressing administrative, legal, collocation and business concerns. 
---Maintain a thorough knowledge of customer contracts, market-level agreements, and pricing guidelines so that customer agreement specifics, fees and pricing estimates can be calculated and communicated to customers. 
---Establish and maintain strong relationships with customer contacts; resolve issues with a high level of customer service. 
---Provide weekly, monthly, and quarterly forecast reports for all revenue-producing activity. 
---Other duties as assigned. 
What You Need to Succeed
---Bachelor’s degree required. 
---Legal, finance, account management, sales, and/or real estate experience preferred. 
---At least 5 to 7 years’ experience building strong customer relationships required. 
---At least 3 years’ experience with contract negotiations and/or commercial sales required 
---At least 3 years’ analytical experience working with numbers preferred. 
---Project management experience preferred. Wireless industry experience preferred. 
---Approximately 5% travel may be required in support of the position’s responsibilities. 
---Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively. 
---Ability to use Excel, Word, and Salesforce; ability to understand financials models and concepts. 
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to effectively and professionally achieve results. 
---Strong organizational skills; ability to accomplish multiple tasks within the agreed upon timeframes through effective prioritization of duties and functions in a fast-paced environment.

The Team
The U.S. Division of American Tower is seeking an Attorney II to join the Real Estate Legal & Compliance group’s Real Estate Land Rights, Rooftops & Conflict Resolution team. In this role, you will analyze our rights and obligations in a variety of agreements, assess risk exposure, partner cross-functionally to understand risk tolerance and operational concerns, and develop creative resolutions for American Tower. Day-to-day, you will engage in communications to answer questions, deescalate conflicts, and solve a wide range of issues in a high-volume environment. Your responsibilities will include negotiating and drafting custom easement, license, management, marketing, and pre-litigation settlement agreements and providing clear and concise explanations of how you propose to resolve disputes and optimize American Tower’s operations. 
What You Can Offer Us
---Develop and maintain a thorough knowledge of applicable customer agreements. Negotiate resolutions of customer issues related to disputes over our ground rights. Serve as an escalation point for customer matters. 
---Develop and maintain a thorough knowledge of applicable landowner agreements. Serve as an escalation point and resolve real estate/title disputes that put asset ownership at risk or may inhibit a customer’s ability to license space at a particular location. 
---Negotiate and draft custom easement, license, management and settlement agreements, and develop non-boilerplate, documents as required to support licensing, real estate, M&A, and business proposal negotiations and compliance. 
---Provide guidance on best practices and procedures for related legal team functions, including reviewing and revising template documents, preparing new agreements, and formulating procedures to ensure a legally protected and compliant transaction. 
---Provide written and verbal executive-level summaries to the management team in advance of executing material contracts or proposals, while being willing to support and/or opine on the merits of the business aspects of such proposals. 
---Inform external and internal customers of project statuses, procedural requirements, and changes that impact the business relationship and resolve complex issues including tower relocation projects or use of owned land for non-core business activities. 
---Other duties as assigned. 

What You Need To Succeed
---Juris Doctor degree and a license to practice law in any state required. 
---A minimum of 5 years of relevant legal experience required. 
---Experience negotiating complex contracts/licenses and drafting original or unique contractual provisions strongly preferred. 
---Experience in the telecommunications tower or carrier industry strongly preferred. 
---Ability to apply legal expertise and experience to make sound business decisions; knowledgeable about practices, trends, technology, and information that affect the department and the organization. 
---Excellent negotiation skills; ability to effectively resolve complex issues and conflicts in relation to agreement and contract compliance. 
---Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively. 
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to effectively and professionally achieve results. 
---Strong organizational skills; ability to accomplish multiple tasks within the agreed upon timeframes through effective prioritization of duties and functions in a fast-paced environment.

The Team
We are seeking a Principal Engineer, Cybersecurity Engineering to join American Tower’s Information Security team. The team protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data and systems in core systems and platforms. Day to day you will observe all the security operations occurring across the networks and manage the security infrastructure that facilitates those operations. You will support a team of security operations engineers who work within our solutions to prevent cybersecurity incidents, managing tools and processes to identify, analyze, communicate, and contain cybersecurity incidents while working with the incident response team to mitigate risks that occur.
What You Can Offer Us
---Lead and coach the security operations engineering team, applying critical thinking to understand new and emerging threats and working with cyber threat intelligence and threat modeling sources; build and execute required action plans. 
---Expert level of knowledge specific to Next Generation Firewalls, ZTNA technologies, Identity and Access Management, Zero Trust methodologies, Attack Surface Reduction, Cloud Security, Microsoft Defender Suite including Entra ID. 
---Collaborate with other teams to design and implement robust security architectures for systems, networks, and applications while considering factors such as scalability, reliability, and compliance requirements. 
---Plan, organize, and oversee cybersecurity projects from inception to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time, within budget, and according to specifications. 
---Operationalize future Information Security implementations with guidance from the Director of Global Security Operations. 
---Act as an operational subject matter expert between corporate Information Security and the company’s various lines of business in the development and enforcement of appropriate policies, standards, frameworks, and tools. 
---Mentor and guide the team, cultivating a sense of security awareness and arranging for continuous education. 
---Work with Information Security Directors to facilitate tabletop exercises, security drills, and pen tests. 
---Manage risk remediation tools and protocols to ensure issues are mitigated, risks are accounted for, and exceptions are tracked in accordance with the company’s frameworks, policies, and standards. 
---Lead the optimization of systems that perform network monitoring and intrusion detection analyses using various computer network defense tools, such as intrusion detection/prevention systems, firewalls, host-based security systems, etc. 
---Constructively engage business partners regarding cybersecurity issues, including providing quarterly updates to the Information Security Executive Committee. 
What You Need to Succeed
---Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required. 
---8+ years of security engineering, SecOps, Data Loss Protection, event management, security monitoring, and risk-based alerting experience highly desired. 
---Information security experience working with advanced threat detection and remediation desired. 
---Strong ability to convey complex information risk and security issues in a manner that is easily understood and actionable and constructively challenges prevailing thoughts and processes. 
---Sound judgment, a sense of urgency, and a commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service, and business integrity. 
---Approximately 10% travel may be required to support the position’s responsibilities. 
---Strong organization, planning, and project management skills; ability to prioritize tasks for yourself and a team to meet requirements and deadlines. 
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to achieve results effectively and professionally. 
---Strong leadership skills; ability to drive and motivate a team to achieve results. 
American Tower is a global digital infrastructure company serving customers through tower sites and other real estate solutions that support connectivity and opportunity, focused on achieving our vision of Building a More Connected World. The Team
We are seeking a Revenue Administration Supervisor to join American Tower’s Revenue Administration group within the Finance Support Services team. The Revenue Administration group is responsible for processing customer purchase orders, as well as the creation, maintenance, billing and reconciliation of revenue projects. Day to day you will drive continuous improvements of processes and performance while managing efforts to capture accurate data and generate invoices, Siterra projects and log purchase orders in a timely manner. As the Supervisor of Revenue Administration, you will drive success with internal customers by partnering cross-functionally to communicate best practices, develop and maintain consistent standards, and enforce policies related to key inputs and outputs of the revenue administration process.
What You Can Offer Us
---Recruit, supervise and develop staff. You’ll also be expected to cultivate a collaborative team dynamic that enables us to meet our business objectives. 
---Provide oversight of the purchase order receipt, analysis, and entry of PO’s into internal applications. 
---Provide oversight of the non-recurring billing process for services and fees revenue and issuance of invoices to customers. 
---Supervise Siterra project setup and purchase order application process daily. 
---Review, processing, and approval of customer adjustments. 
---Perform system data reconciliations and exception reporting. 
---Reduce the cost and time associated with processing services and fees. 
---Deliver metrics to maximize productivity while accomplishing the organization’s goals and objectives. 
---Implement improvements to current processes in order to maximize efficiency. 
---Assist with developing, deploying, and monitoring of robotic process automations (“RPA”). 
---Assist with designing and deploying strategic operational projects. 
---Provide exceptional customer service and partnership to the Operations organization and external customers. 
---Other duties as assigned. 
What You Need To Succeed
---Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required. 
---A minimum of 3 years of business experience required; financial or operational experience preferred. 
---Supervisor experience preferred. 
---Experience with Oracle, Microsoft Office Suite preferred. 
---Project Management and Process Improvement experience strongly preferred. 
---Excellent written and oral communication skills, with ability to present ideas and information clearly and confidently. 
---RPA and PMP certification recommended. 
---Approximately 5% travel may be required in support of the position’s responsibilities. 
---Astute planning skills along with the ability to lead through influence and be a proactive partner with a strong customer-service orientation. 
---Strong organization, planning, and project management skills; ability to prioritize tasks for self and team to meet requirements and deadlines. 
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to effectively and professionally achieve results. 
---Strong leadership skills; ability to drive and motivate team to achieve results.

The Team
The U.S. Division of American Tower is seeking an Attorney I to join the Real Estate Legal & Compliance group’s Real Estate Land Rights, Rooftops & Conflict Resolution team.   In this role, you will analyze our rights and obligations in a variety of agreements, assess risk exposure, partner cross-functionally to understand risk tolerance and operational concerns, and develop creative resolutions for American Tower.  Day-to-day, you will engage in communications to answer questions, deescalate conflicts, and solve a wide range of issues in a high-volume environment.  Your responsibilities will include negotiating and drafting custom easement, license, management, marketing, and pre-litigation settlement agreements and providing clear and concise explanations of how you propose to resolve disputes and optimize American Tower’s operations. 
What You Can Offer Us
---Develop and maintain a thorough knowledge of applicable customer and/or landowner agreements; regularly communicate with external customers regarding contractual rights and obligations; negotiate resolutions to customer issues related to non- compliance. 
---Coordinate and communicate with internal departments to satisfactorily resolve issues with property owners and/or external customers. 
---Prepare new license agreements, amendments, ground lease documents, access and utility agreements, use authorization and consent agreements, memoranda of leases, and consent and notice letters in compliance with Company’s standards. 
---Prepare legal analyses of and negotiate resolution of property owner transactions, customer requests, project permitting, and the adoption of applicable legislation or regulations. 
---Help resolve title curative issues, including but not limited to missing deeds, missing memoranda of lease/assignments, utility and access easement issues, mortgages, all liens (except mechanic’s), probate issues, improper signature authority, and issues concerning Company entities; work with external title companies in accordance with internal policy. 
---Other duties as assigned. 
What You Need To Succeed
---Juris Doctor and license to practice law in any state required. 
---Between 1-3 years of experience working with contract/license drafting and negotiation strongly preferred. 
---Strong negotiation skills; ability to effectively resolve complex issues and conflicts in relation to agreement and contract compliance. 
---Attention to detail in the preparation and review of contracts and supporting documents; strong legal drafting skills. 
---Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively. 
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to effectively and professionally achieve results. 
---Strong organizational skills; ability to accomplish multiple tasks within the agreed upon timeframes through effective prioritization of duties and functions in a fast-paced environment.

The Team
We are seeking a Business Report Developer to join American Tower’s Finance Data Analytics (FDA) team. The FDA team partners with internal stakeholders to provide actionable analyses and recommendations driven by detailed analytics. Day to day you will create analytical reports and dashboards, combine information from disparate systems and assist with enterprise data warehouse reporting projects that help inform key business decisions. As a Business Report Developer, you will partner cross-functionally to develop and deliver standardized reporting by using best practices of presenting and visualizing data for internal customers.
What You Can Offer Us
---Design and develop analytics products (data visualizations, dashboards, automations etc.) in support of business initiatives. 
---Identify data patterns and insights through advanced analytics (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics). 
---Interface with IT and Business teams to identify the data modeling needs for reporting and analytics development. 
---Lead efforts to implement reporting and data solutions that accurately address complex business needs. 
---Administer object and data level security for the data analytics dashboard and reports according to the requirements. 
---Support departmental needs for ad hoc reporting. 
---Support documentation need during the design development and postproduction of the analytics products. 
---Other duties as assigned. 
What You Need to Succeed
---Bachelor’s degree required, with a concentration in Computer Science, Business or a related quantitative discipline preferred. 
---A minimum of 4+ years’ data analytics experience required; must be able to visualize and interpret data. 
---Experience with one or more of the following platforms required: 
---Oracle Analytics OAS, OBIEE) or an equivalent enterprise business intelligence platform (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) 
---ETL tools (ODI/Informatica or similar), database development 
---Data science skills such as Scripting languages including Python, R; experience in Machine learning is a plus. 
---Experience with Oracle EBS, Salesforce as data sources for analytics. 
---High Proficiency with SQL querying and knowledge of data modeling. 
---Familiarity with predictive analytics modeling and financial concepts. 
---Meticulous attention to detail with an appreciation for the relationship between data quality, key performance indicators, and the Company’s success. 
---Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively. 
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to achieve results effectively and professionally.

The Team
We are seeking an Engineering Designer I to join American Tower’s Engineering team. The Engineering team maintains the safety and longevity of our towers and ensures high level compliance with industry standards. Day to day you will use Computer Aided Drafting and Design to develop wireless carrier-specific construction drawings that may include electrical layouts, site plans, customer installation drawings, and structural modification drawings for telecommunication towers. As an Engineering Designer I, you will partner cross-functionally to, in accordance with customer feedback, verify customer applications, equipment placement, compound accuracy, revisions, and construction drawings. You will also perform other services as required by the Structural Engineering team.
What You Can Offer Us
---Operate AutoCAD with a basic understanding of national and internal CAD standards; prioritize work queues to meet deadlines. 
---Collaborate with Design team members and Engineers on design matters. 
---Maintain drawing integrity by continually updating CAD drawings with applicable additions and changes. 
---Utilize surveys and other information sources to maintain compound accuracy. Evaluate the best location for proposed equipment within the compound while considering contractual restrictions and ease of access. 
---Coordinate with team members and organizational partners to incorporate vendor equipment in construction documents and details. 
---Create unique detailing and designs for basic projects consisting of steel design, electrical engineering, and civil engineering. 
---Perform peer review of basic drawings. 
---Revise drawings in accordance with instructions from the engineer, customer, and team members. 
---Other duties as assigned. 
What You Need To Succeed
---Bachelor’s degree in a related field required or, instead, an Associate degree in a related field combined with either 1 year of construction, engineering firm, or telecommunications industry experience or, for the Steel Design team, 1 year of either steel design or fabrication detailing in CAD required. 
---Advanced Steel, Civil 3D, Inventor, Infra Works, or other BIM software experience strongly preferred. 
---Detail oriented with the ability to produce accurate construction drawings and site plans. 
---Proficient with computer software programs, including AutoCAD 2017 or higher and Microsoft Word, Outlook, and Excel. 
---Basic knowledge of structural components, construction, and general engineering concepts. 
---Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively. 
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to effectively and professionally achieve results. 
---Strong organizational skills; ability to accomplish multiple tasks within the agreed upon timeframes through effective prioritization of duties and functions in a fast-paced environment.

The Team
We are seeking an Operations Site Lead to join American Tower’s Network Operations department. The Operations Site Leads are American Tower’s frontline representation in the field with customers, vendors, and landowners and support the Network Operations department as well as various interdepartmental objectives. Day to day you will collect data from all assigned tower assets while maintaining high standards of data quality. You will use multiple methods for data collection, including Unmanned Aircraft Systems (“UAS”). As an Operations Site Lead, you will partner cross-functionally to manage maintenance and repairs within a geographic area for all asset types, including towers, rooftop installations, fiber-based networks, and generators.
What You Can Offer Us
---Perform routine site audits on assets in an assigned area/zone in an efficient and cost-effective manner, utilizing UAS and other data collection tools. 
---Ensure all assets in said area/zone meet safety, compliance, and asset integrity standards through implementation of the Company’s Standard of Care and other management policies by identifying and documenting discrepancies and following through on needed remediation. 
---Effectively engage with customers and vendors to manage projects, ensuring timelines and safety standards are met during pre-construction meetings and post-construction site walks and when gathering and processing closeout data for customer construction and internally generated projects. 
---Meet customer service level agreements by responding quickly to any issues with the Company’s back-up generators, fiber- based networks, or emergency response to critical events. 
---Approximately 75% of time role will be performed outside of a conventional office environment visiting assets in a Company vehicle. 
---Other duties as assigned. 
What You Need to Succeed
---High school diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor’s degree preferred. 
---Minimum 2 years of work experience in telecommunications or a related field required. 
---Must be at least 21 years old, have a valid driver’s license, have a demonstrated safe driving record, and be able to travel extensively by car or truck. 
---Must have, or within a year of hire obtain, FAA Part 107 Certification to operate UAS. 
---Vendor management experience, real-estate management experience, or a civil construction background preferred. 
---Knowledge of radio transmitters, receivers, antennas, radio frequency, wireless, or ethernet backhaul experience preferred. 
---Ability to use discretion when setting priorities and resolving issues in accordance with Company best practices and standards. 
---Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word and Excel; ability to use additional Company software applications. 
---While performing the role, you will need to lift up to 60 lbs. and be able to traverse developed and undeveloped construction sites. 
---Approximately 40% overnight travel may be required in support of the position’s responsibilities. 
---Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively. 
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to effectively and professionally achieve results. 
---Strong organizational skills; ability to accomplish multiple tasks within the agreed upon timeframes through effective prioritization of duties and functions in a fast-paced environment.

The Team
We are seeking a Staff Accountant join American Tower’s Technical Transaction Group in the Global Business Services (GBS) Organization. The Global Business Services team is responsible for developing and managing business service centers to execute accounting and transactional activities resulting in efficiency, quality and enhanced strategic decision support. Day to day you will focus on the financial aspects of the Company’s leases, properly recording the Company’s straight-line adjustments in the general ledger. 
The Staff Accountant will obtain appropriate supporting documentation, coordinate with other groups, and lead contract-related projects and audits in accordance with the company policies and relevant GAAP guidance. You will analyze requests to change terms of existing contracts and support internal customers with post-revision financial information in accordance with internal guidelines. The Staff Accountant will prepare journal entries, reports, and financial presentations by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing contract information to support external reporting requirements as well as local management requirements and reporting needs.
What You Can Offer Us
---Perform monthly financial close activities including:
------Own preforming analyses of profit and loss accounts.
------Own preforming balance sheet reconciliations, ensuring transactions are reported properly to support REIT and securitization reporting; and
------Maintain internal control documentation, checklists, and audits to comply with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.
---Ensure financial records are maintained in compliance with the relevant GAAP guidance and internal policies and procedures. 
---Review key business terms of various contracts to support internal customers’ needs.
---Analyze and interpret leases to identify financial clauses that help assess and manage the Company’s financials, including various contract terms such as term, termination rights and billing amount.
---Coordinate on contract terms and provisions with other departments.
---Analyze requests to change terms of existing contracts; support internal customers with post-revision financial information.
---Prepare reports and financial presentations by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing contract information.
---Clarify contract interpretation and pricing questions with internal teams.
---Perform audits on loaded contracts to ensure that financial terms were processed correctly.
---Research contract questions or inquires for internal customers.
---Perform intermediate contract research for management team.
---Lead cross-organizational projects impacting land and tenant lease data; effectively communicate processes and collaborate on best practices.
---Identify, and review with peers, situations when accounting guidelines present multiple interpretations for a particular lease and escalate to manager for resolution as necessary; offer ideas for resolution to correct exceptions and prevent recurrence of issues going forward.
---Work closely with the Lease Abstraction, Lease Administration, Land Management, Legal, Landlord Relations, and Finance departments to implement and/or support process improvement and develop best practices.
---Other duties as assigned.
What You Need to Succeed
---Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance required.
---Between 1–2 years of relevant experience in an office environment required.
---Experience reviewing contracts (such as revenue and ground lease contracts) preferred.
---Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite.
---Strong customer service skills with a track record of building and maintaining positive relationships with internal and external customers and vendors.
---Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively.
---Ability to work with different functional groups and levels of employees to achieve results effectively and professionally.
---Strong organizational skills: ability to accomplish multiple tasks within the agreed upon timeframes through effective prioritization of duties and functions in a fast-paced environment.
